1. hitting a ball (with a bat, golf club, etc.); batting; stroke Sports

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to hit; to strike; to knock; to beat; to punch; to slap; to tap; to bang; to clap; to pound 階段から落ちて背中を強く打ちました。I fell down the stairs and hit my back very hard.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to strike (noon, etc.); to sound (cymbals, etc.); to beat (a drum, etc.) ８時をちょうど打ちましたね。It has just struck eight, hasn't it?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to beat (rhythmically, e.g. pulse, waves, etc.) 雨が窓を打った。The rain whipped against the window.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to move; to impress; to touch 私たちはその話を聞いたとき、畏敬の念に打たれてしまった。We were awed into silence when we heard the story.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to drive in; to hammer in; to put in; to inject; to vaccinate

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to type; to send; to transmit 今度の事務員の方が前の事務員よりタイプを打つのが速い。The new secretary types faster than the old one.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to insert; to write in; to mark

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to make (noodles, etc.); to prepare

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to till (soil)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 10. to sprinkle; to throw; to cast

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 11. to do; to carry out; to play; to perform; to engage in (gambling, etc.) スロットを打っているうちに、あれよあれよと今の時間です。I was hitting the slots, and before I knew it, it's this time already.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 12. to pay (a deposit, etc.)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 13. to visit (on a pilgrimage)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 14. to line (a coat)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 15. to bind (a criminal)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'tsu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 16. to drop (a piece) Shogi

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to drive in (a nail, stake, etc.); to hammer in 板にくぎを打ち込んだ。He hammered nails into the plank.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to hit (a ball, etc.); to drive; to smash

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to fire into; to shoot into also written as 撃ち込む

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to input (data); to enter ノートパソコンの電源を入れ、ブラウザを立ち上げて、もう覚えてしまったアドレスを打ち込む。I switch on my laptop, start up the browser, and type in the address I've already learnt by heart.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to devote oneself to; to be absorbed in; to be (really) into; to be enthusiastic about; to put heart and soul into; to throw oneself into; to go head over heels for 彼はその仕事に打ち込んだ。He applied himself to the task.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to practice hitting (baseball, tennis, etc.) Sports

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to hit (an opponent in kendo, boxing, etc.); to get a blow in Martial arts

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to invade one's opponent's territory; to place a stone in an opponent's formation Go (game)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to pour (concrete, etc.) into a form

ぶっつかる
1. to hit (e.g. one's head); to strike; to knock; to run (into); to crash (into) Usually written using kana alone彼は頭を棚に強くぶつけて大きなこぶを作った。He banged his head against a shelf and got a big lump.
2. to throw (at); to fling (at); to hurl (at) Usually written using kana alone私に泥をぶつけて、泥だらけになった。He threw mud at me and made me dirty.

3. to vent (e.g. one's anger); to express (one's feelings); to throw (a question at someone) Usually written using kana alone選挙民は投票によって不満をぶつけています。Voters are taking out their frustrations at the polls.
4. to pit (someone) against; to set against; to match against; to put up against Usually written using kana alone
打付ける: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. to hit (e.g. one's head); to strike; to knock; to run (into); to crash (into) Usually written using kana alone彼は頭を棚に強くぶつけて大きなこぶを作った。He banged his head against a shelf and got a big lump.
2. to throw (at); to fling (at); to hurl (at) Usually written using kana alone私に泥をぶつけて、泥だらけになった。He threw mud at me and made me dirty.

3. to vent (e.g. one's anger); to express (one's feelings); to throw (a question at someone) Usually written using kana alone選挙民は投票によって不満をぶつけています。Voters are taking out their frustrations at the polls.
4. to pit (someone) against; to set against; to match against; to put up against Usually written using kana alone
打付ける: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: He banged his head against a shelf and got a big lump.
He threw mud at me and made me dirty.
Voters are taking out their frustrations at the polls.
